title: BBC Local Live: Essex on Monday, 21 March 2016 - BBC News
summary: former boyfriend found guilty of murdering becky parker .
former mp harvey proctor says he has been told he faces no further action over claims of child abuse .
news , sport , weather and travel updates resume at 08:00 on tuesday .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: thanks for following our updates today .
we 'll be back tomorrow morning with more news , travel and sport from across the county .
have a great evening .

documents.title: becky parker : ex-boyfriend told to expect long sentence
text: a man who has been found guilty of murdering his ex-partner , who was six months pregnant , will be sentenced tomorrow .
judge charles gratwicke said matthew smith , 24 , could expect a substantial sentence when he returns to chelmsford crown court on tuesday .
he was found guilty earlier of murdering becky parker .
det ch insp martin pasmore said : `` the jury has today seen through his lies and convicted him of murder . ''
author: Jodie Smith
BBC News

documents.title: flare discovered in murder victim 's car
text: detectives investigating the murder of vilson meshi in basildon are appealing for information after a flare was discovered in his vehicle .
mr meshi 's body was found in the back of his fire-damaged audi in pincey mead last month .
police have now revealed they discovered a hansson ikaros red hand held flare .
three teenagers arrested in connection with the incident have been released on bail .
author: Tom Croasdell
BBC Essex

documents.title: colchester united fans praised for support
text: the colchester united midfielder alex gilby has been praising the support from u 's fans .
he says their backing has been impressive despite the team 's lowly position at the bottom of the league one table .
gilby says the supporters ' backing was particularly impressive at walsall , where they were beaten 2-1 on saturday .
author: Nick Alliker
BBC Essex

documents.title: headlines : maldon man convicted of ex-girlfriend 's murder flare discovered in murder probe
text: here are your headlines this evening :
author: Claire Gregory
BBC Essex

documents.title: travel : a1306 new road in rainham closed
text: the a1306 new road in rainham is closed between the marsh way junction and the manor way junction , because of an accident .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: travel : severe delays and one lane closed on m11 southbound
text: there are severe delays and one lane is closed on the m11 southbound between j9 a11 saffron walden and j8 , a120 ( bishops stortford ) , because of a serious accident involving a car and recovery work .
congestion to j11 , a10 ( cambridge south ) .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: harvey proctor : former mp calls for police resignations
text: harvey proctor has called for scotland yard boss sir bernard hogan-howe and a string of senior officers to resign , after he says he was cleared of child abuse .

the investigation , looking at claims that boys were sexually abused by a number of public figures more than 30 years ago , saw raids on the homes of 92-year-old d-day veteran lord bramall and the late lord brittan .

mr proctor said : `` i consider that sir bernard hogan-howe , ( assistant commissioner ) pat gallan , ( deputy assistant commissioner ) steve rodhouse and ( det supt ) kenny macdonald should tender their resignations from the metropolitan police service forthwith . ''

documents.title: sponsored walk raises £ 2,000 for attacked football fan simon dobbin
text: friends and family of football fan simon dobbin , who was left with brain damage after an attack , have raised £ 2,000 with a 12-mile sponsored walk .
the cambridge united fan was attacked following a match in southend a year ago today .
he returned to his home in mildenhall last week .
the money will be used to pay for equipment to help provide him with care .
author: Jeremy Sallis
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: union condemns proposed changes to meal breaks for paramedics
text: the union unison has `` condemned '' the east of england ambulance service over proposed changes to meal breaks and end of shift arrangements .
it says the proposals will end the right of staff to have a meal at base , and crews will be expected to answer non-emergency calls at the end of their shifts .
fraer stevenson , unison branch secretary at the trust , said the plans were `` a huge risk for patient safety and staff welfare '' .
in a consultation document the trust says it intends to trial a number of measures to reduce the number of late finishes and `` better support colleagues '' .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : fine and dry
text: the rest of today will be fine and dry with sunny spells .
highs of 12c ( 54f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: killer matthew smith 'destroyed a loving family '
text: the murder of a pregnant mother of two by her ex-boyfriend has been described as `` sickening '' by police .
det ch insp martin pasmore , who led the investigation into the murder of isobel parker , known as becky , said : .
`` despite overwhelming evidence , smith chose to put isobel 's family through the ordeal of a court case .
the jury has today seen through his lies and convicted him of murder .
`` isobel had everything to live for , but smith took it all away and destroyed a loving and supportive family in the process .
my thoughts are very much with them today . ''
author: Jodie Smith
BBC News

documents.title: becky parker : pregnant mum found dead in the bath
text: a man who has been found guilty of murdering the mother of his two children is thought to have strangled her in the kitchen before placing her in the bath .
becky parker 's sister called 999 after finding her lying in the bath with cable ties around her neck .
she was pronounced dead along with her unborn daughter .
ms parker 's former boyfriend matthew smith , 24 , has been found guilty of her murder .
author: Jodie Smith
BBC News

documents.title: becky parker : killer matthew smith 'upset ' after relationship ended
text: a man who has been found guilty of murdering his pregnant ex-girlfriend at her home in burnham-on-crouch was upset that she had ended their relationship , the court heard .
factory worker matthew smith , 24 , had been in a relationship for some years with 23-year-old becky parker .
they had two children together , a three-year-old boy and an 18-month-old girl .
the court heard that smith did not want their relationship to end and felt distressed after finding out she was pregnant with her new partner .
author: Jodie Smith
BBC News

documents.title: travel : m11 partially blocked
text: the m11 is partially blocked and there 's queuing traffic southbound between j9 ( a11 saffron walden ) and j8 ( a120 bishops stortford ) because of a crash .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: becky parker : former boyfriend strangled her to death
text: the former boyfriend of 23-year-old isobel rebecca parker , known as becky , was found guilty of her murder by a majority verdict of 10-2 after two days of deliberations .
matthew smith , 24 , of wood corner caravan park , maldon , strangled the pregnant mother of two to death with cable ties , the three-week trial at chelmsford crown court heard .
she was found dead at a flat in booth place , burnham-on-crouch , last july .
author: Chris Flynn
BBC Essex

documents.title: breakingbecky parker : former boyfriend guilty of murder
text: the former boyfriend of a mother who was strangled to death has been found guilty of her murder .

documents.title: harvey proctor : former mp calls for public inquiry
text: former basildon and billericay mp harvey proctor , who says he has been cleared of child abuse , had strenuously denied allegations that he was part of a vip paedophile ring that murdered three boys .
he is understood to be the last living person who was under investigation .
mr proctor has called for a public inquiry into operation midland , the £ 1.8m probe into the claims .
the met is expected to make an announcement shortly .

documents.title: harvey proctor : ex-mp 'faces no further police action '
text: harvey proctor , who says he has been cleared of child abuse , was twice interviewed under caution as part of operation midland .
he has consistently denied any wrongdoing , claiming he was the victim of a homosexual witch hunt .

the 69-year-old said : `` i have been advised that the metropolitan police service has informed my solicitors that they intend to take no further action with regard to my involvement with operation midland . ''
the development comes amid mounting speculation that the met is poised to announce the winding-up of the investigation , which was launched in november 2014 .
the force has yet to comment .

documents.title: breakingharvey proctor 'faces no further action over child abuse claims '
text: former conservative mp harvey proctor says he has been told he will face no further action in relation to scotland yard 's investigation into historical child abuse allegations .
he represented basildon from 1979 to 1983 and billericay from 1983 to 1987 .

documents.title: horse dies in hatfield heath stable fire
text: a horse has died and another is being treated for injuries after a stable fire in hatfield heath .
firefighters put out the fire in dunmow road at 03:50 this morning and are currently investigating the cause .
assistant divisional officer len cleary said : `` crews acted swiftly and efficiently to prevent this incident from escalating .
some of the buildings were completely destroyed by the fire .
`` the quick actions of firefighters helped rescue the remaining six horses from the stables . ''
author: Claire Gregory
BBC Essex

documents.title: headlines : microflight pilot dies man arrested in connection with pensioner attack
text: here are the top stories we are looking at this lunchtime :
author: Claire Gregory
BBC Essex

documents.title: southend united boss sets points target for blues
text: the southend united boss phil brown is setting his side a points target of the mid-seventies to get into the league one end-of-season play-offs .
the promotion hopefuls are currently ninth in the table with 55 points .
the blues had to settle for one point on saturday after drawing with gillingham at roots hall .
author: Nick Alliker
BBC Essex

documents.title: ambulance service says current meal break arrangements 'undermining ' ability to respond to patients
text: the ambulance service says it is considering changes to meal breaks and end of shift arrangements for paramedics because they are `` undermining '' the ability to respond to patients .
the eastern daily press reports about 600 ambulance staff have signed an open letter `` condemning the plans '' .

in a draft consultation document released last week , the trust says it needs to take `` meaningful '' steps to reduce the risks to patients , but intends to trial a number of measures to `` better support colleagues '' .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: becky parker jury still out
text: the jury are still considering what verdict to deliver here at chelmsford crown court , in the case of a young mother who was strangled to death .
isobel parker , who was known as becky , was found lying dead in the bath in her burnham-on-crouch flat last july .
her former partner matthew smith accepts he killed her but denies murder .
author: Chris Flynn
BBC Essex

documents.title: man arrested in connection with pensioner attack
text: a 41-year-old man from chelmsford has been arrested following an incident in which a 70-year-old woman was punched in the head .
the incident happened on the street in little waltham , at around 15:45 on 1 march .
a man approached the victim as she walked her dog and punched her three times in the unprovoked attack .

documents.title: ambulance service plans to increase use of private vehicles
text: patients in essex calling for an ambulance could be taken to hospital by taxi .
author: East Anglian Daily Times

documents.title: ambulance staff 'sign letter opposing meal-break plans '
text: about 600 staff at the east of england ambulance service have signed an open letter opposing plans to change meal-breaks for paramedics and other responders , the eastern daily press reports .

a consultation document sent out by the trust last week suggests current meal breaks and end of shift agreements are having a `` denigratory '' impact on the service 's ability to respond to patients .

a spokesman for eeast said : `` not unlike all ambulance services across england , eeast recognises the impact that shift overruns have on our staff and we have put in place a number of measures to tackle this . ''
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: braintree town manager praises team 's 'work ethic '
text: the braintree town manager danny cowley has been praising his team 's `` work ethic '' as they push for a place in the football league .
the iron remain in the national league play-off places , currently sitting in fifth position .
at the weekend , they beat the league leaders cheltenham town .
cowley says his side is a `` quality team '' rather than a `` group of individuals '' .
author: Nick Alliker
BBC Essex

documents.title: flights cancelled at stansted
text: stansted airport says 13 flights were cancelled yesterday and 23 have been cancelled today because of industrial action by french air traffic controllers in protest at planned staff cuts .
ryanair has called on the french government and the european commission to intervene in order to prevent uk passengers being `` held to ransom '' by `` tiny numbers '' of french workers .
the airline is urging its customers to sign a petition to the european commission , which it hopes will bring an end to the `` repeated blackmail and disruption by atc unions '' .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: mother wishes her daughter was treated more quickly
text: donna howe , from vange near basildon , says her daughter could have survived if she 'd been treated more quickly .
she was misdiagnosed by an out-of-hours doctor and an inquest found her death last may could have been avoided .
you 're sitting there with a sick child and you just want someone to hurry up and get here .
maybe if i had ranted and raved a bit , maybe if i had been a bit more hysterical , they would have understood the severity of it . ''

documents.title: my daughter 'could be alive if she 'd been treated more quickly '
text: an essex mum says her daughter could still be alive today if it was n't for a number of nhs failures .
seven-year-old malaika adam , from vange near basildon , was diagnosed with a stomach bug but she actually had a burst appendix and sepsis .
she died in may .
both the nhs 111 service and the east of england ambulance trust have apologised to the family for delays in treatment .

documents.title: police release photo of man wanted in connection with nightclub attack
text: police have released a photo of a man they want to speak to in connection with the assault of a woman inside a basildon nightclub .
detectives are investigating the assault of a woman aged in her 30s during the early hours of 21 february .
it happened inside unit 7 on the festival leisure park .
author: Charlie Jones
BBC Local Live

documents.title: singer 'overwhelmed ' at being chosen for the voice 's live shows
text: essex singer lydia lucy says she is `` overwhelmed '' at being chosen for the voice 's live shows by coach will.i.am.she was one of 16 acts who performed for the all-star panel of paloma faith , boy george , ricky wilson and will.i.am on last night 's knock-out stage .
the 22-year-old wowed the judges with her fiery rendition of i knew you were trouble by taylor swift , in which she switched between singing and rapping .
author: Jodie Smith
BBC News

documents.title: investigation into microlight crash
text: a crash in which a microlight pilot from essex died is being investigated by the air accidents investigation branch .
it happened at 16:18 yesterday in rochester , kent .
louise holloway , who lives nearby , was outside in the garden when she heard a `` huge bang '' and saw `` a massive orange flash right across the sky '' .
`` one man ran across the field but there was no way the pilot could have got out , '' she said .
`` it 's really sad . ''

documents.title: microlight pilot from essex dies in crash
text: a pilot has died after his microlight hit an electricity pylon yesterday and burst into flames .
the 56-year-old man , from essex , was pronounced dead at the scene of the crash in rochester , kent .
his next of kin have been informed .
no-one else was in the aircraft .

documents.title: weather : cloudy but fine
text: the odd spot of drizzle to begin with , but today will be a fine day with cloud at times , but also some sunny spells .
the best of the sunshine will be through the middle part of the day .
maximum temperature : 12c ( 54f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: headlines : microlight pilot dies man has unknown substance thrown in his face
text: here are your headlines this morning :
author: Sonia Watson
BBC Essex

documents.title: welcome to monday 's essex live page
text: hello and welcome to another week on the essex live page , where we 'll bring you all the latest news , sport , weather and travel for the county until 18:00 .
if you think there 's something we should be talking about , or you 'd just like to say hello , you can email us , tweet us or head over to our facebook page .
author: Charlie Jones
BBC Local Live
